sense.name: making modern
sense.commentary: MODERNIZATION[+event] The act of changing the appearance or behavior of something to meet current standards.
sense.examples: The modernization of Nigeria will be a long process. The building underwent an expensive modernization, but the electricity still doesn't work. The Senate supports the modernization of the highway system.

sense.name: something modernized
sense.commentary: Something that has been modernized. Usually refers to a artistic work.
sense.examples: The popular Broadway musical "Rent" is a modernization of "La Boheme" with updated themes and musical styles. John sent his modernization of "The Great Gatsby" to a dozen publishers, but nobody liked it.
